alert.note: Alert for Kimble (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 11:26AM CDT until May 13 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Kimble and Mason. * WHEN...Until 230 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1125 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hilda, Hedwigs Hill, Loyal Valley, Us-87 Near The Mason- Gillespie County Line, I-10 Near The Kimble-Kerr County Line, The Intersection Of I-10 And Us 290 and Us-83 Near The Kerr- Kimble County Line. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 468 and 477. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... RM 385 crossing Falls Prong, RM 385 crossing Perdenales River, Jeffers Lane crossing, West Simonsville crossing, Simonsville crossing Bader Creek, Simonsville crossing Beaver Creek, Ranch Road 783 crossing Bader Creek, Loeffler crossing Beaver Creek, Ranch Road 783 crossing Deer Creek and Threadgill Creek crossing Squaw Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
